title: What is the relationship between positive science and magic?
first_phrase: This text argues that even though social and physical laws may seem to have a universal perspective, behind that perspective, there are particular elements that are not considered. The statistical character of empirical laws implies that they don't presuppose the idea of active spontaneity. Instead, they reflect a field of probability that indicates plausible outcomes. The author also mentions a few philosophers, including Boutroux and Bruto, to illustrate these concepts. In the last 200 tokens, the text explores the relationship between positive science and magic, highlighting the importance of understanding the limits of scientific predictions.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while the field of positive science may be limited in its ability to fully comprehend the complexities of spirituality and the human consciousness, it is important to recognize the existence of a process of liberation and self-affirmation. This understanding can help us to appreciate the greater possibilities of existence beyond the realm of physical reality and uniform statistical patterns.
